sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 2x2 matrix, we use the formula:

det(A) = ad - bc

where A is the given matrix:

\begin{bmatrix}
a & b \\
c & d \\
\end{bmatrix}

In this case, a = 4, b = 7, c = 2, and d = -3. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

det(A) = (4)(-3) - (7)(2) = -12 - 14 = -26

So, the determinant of the given matrix is -26.
